case_vignette: A 47-year-old woman comes to the physician because of repetitive tongue twisting and abnormal movements of the hands and legs that started several days ago. She has a 2-year history of schizophrenia that has been controlled with fluphenazine. Two weeks ago, she was switched to risperidone. Examination shows protrusion of the tongue and smacking of the lips. She makes twisting movements of the arms and frequently taps her right foot.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing my tongue twisting on its own and weird movements in my hands and legs that started a few days ago.
Have you taken any new medications recently or had a change in dosage of existing ones?
Yes, two weeks ago, I was switched from one medication to a different one for my schizophrenia.
Can you please tell me the name of the new medication you started taking?
The new medication I started taking is called risperidone.
Do you have any history of neurological disorders in your family?
No, I don't have any family history of neurological disorders.
How old are you and what is your sex?
I'm a 47-year-old woman.
Are the movements you're experiencing persistent or do they come and go?
They've been repetitive, happening over and over again since they started several days ago.
Have you noticed any improvement or worsening of symptoms with rest or movement?
I haven't noticed any change in my symptoms with rest or movement.
Final Diagnosis: Tardive Dyskinesia secondary to risperidone use.
